quotes: Secretary-General of NATO since 2014.
State Secretary 12 November 1990-22 November 1991, Ministry of the Environment.
Councillor of State 7 October 1993-25 October 1996, Chief of the Ministry of Industry and Energy.
Councillor of State 25 October 1996-17 October 1997, Chief of the Ministry of Finance and Customs.
Prime Minister 17 March 2000-19 October 2001.
Prime Minister 17 October 2005-16 October 2013.
Born in Oslo 16 March 1959
Married in Oslo 14 August 1987
interrupted by compulsory military service 1979-1980.
where he was the leader 1985-1989
after having been member of the central board since 1979.
part-time journalist at the national daily Arbeiderbladet 1979-1981
information secretary in Oslo Labour Party in 1981.
In 1985 Stoltenberg was elected member of the Norwegian Labour Party’s central board.
the same year he also became vice president of the International Union of Socialist Youth, a post he held until 1989.
In 1986 Stoltenberg headed a commission to study male roles
He achieved his degree in economy (Cand.Oecon) at the University of Oslo in 1987
He also lectured in economy at the University of Oslo 1989-1990.
Stoltenberg was elected leader of Oslo Labour Party for the period 1990-1992
became deputy leader of the Norwegian Labour Party in 1992.
In November 1990 he accepted an offer to become state secretary
He was member of a government-appointed defence commission 1990-1992.
